comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: I am uncertain, but this looks like Dr. Alexis Carrel, Nobel Laureate for Medicine in 1912. See his bio here: nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/1912/carre... He became attached to the Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, New York in 1906.

comment.author: 34427469121@N01
comment._content: I could be wildly off-base, but that seems like it was taken on a ship.

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: There is an interesting series of Flickr LoC pictures of President Taft going to a big celebration in honor of Carrel, at City College in New York, for example see this one: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2368285067/ here is wikipedia entry about Dr. Carrel: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Carrel

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A search of Ellis Island Records www.ellisislandrecords.org/search/matchMore.asp?LNM=CARRE... suggests that he crossed the Atlantic frequently. So the fact that this was on a ship doesn't help with dating it.

comment.author: 34427469121@N01
comment._content: Wow! That's fascinating, swanq! I didn't even know there was an Ellis Island Records site!

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Alexis Carrel (June 28, 1873 - November 5, 1944) was a French surgeon, biologist and eugenicist, who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1912. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Carrel

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks to everyone for their observations and comments!  It does appear this may be Dr. Alexis Carrel.  We will add more information to the source data and then reload the description to Flickr.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The photo is dated in November, 1912. It is likely that we see Dr. Carrell embarking on a voyage to Sweden to receive his Nobel Prize for Medicine.
